p: The major characteristics of the surfactants are being present at the surface of the interfaces (liquid-air, liquid-liquid, liquid-solid) at higher concentrations compared to the bulk of the liquid [ 97]. Surfactants can be classified based on two characteristics: charge type of the surface active part and the chemical structure of the hydrophilic groups [ 97]. Accordingly, these groups are; anionic (negatively charged), non-ionic (no charged group), cationic (positively charged), and amphoteric (can be positively or negatively charged, or both, depending on the circumstances) surfactants [ 97].
